title: Darwin and the Universality of Expression
description: A micro-lesson that makes Darwin and the Universality of Expression usable.

hook.text: In 1872, Charles Darwin proposed something radical: facial expressions are universal, not cultural.

discovery.text: A century later, Paul Ekman confirmed it: joy, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, and disgust look the same everywhere.

twist.text: Culture shapes when and how we display emotions â€” but the underlying expressions are hardwired by evolution.
